item.title: Acid etches ewer bu baccarat
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The delicate blue etching on this fine antique ewer is offset beautifully by the surrounding frosted glass, resulting in a wonderful visual contrast.
item.content:encoded: Of baluster form, decorated in blue with herons on a riverbank amidst bullrushes and trees, with a star cut base

item.title: Enamelled glass
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This iridescent glass liqueur set is distinctly and impressively detailed, typifying the quality of glass produced by the Moser factory in Bohemia.
item.content:encoded:
Consisting of one jug with stopper and six glasses, in the Islamic style.

Jug with stopper: height 19 cm; diameter 20 cm
Glasses: height 6.8 cm; width 10 cm; depth 5.5 cm

item.title: Matched pairn
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: These charming antique ewers are an excellent example of fine Victorian majolica ware, which the British ceramic manufacturer Minton was famous for.
item.content:encoded: After a design by Hughes Protat, the circular bodies modelled as a barrel with entwined grapevine handles, the shoulders each applied with four Bacchic putti.

item.title: plate painted with a view of riga
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This fine antique plate illustrates a view of Riga, the capital of Lativa, as it would have appeared at the beginning of the 19th century.
item.content:encoded: Circular porcelain plate with painted scene, the landscape within a viridian green border with gilt decor.

item.title: Pair of ormolu mounted sevres
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: An elegant duo, the opulence of these fine antique French vases will enhance the décor of any setting, be it a public or a private space
item.content:encoded: On blue ground, the front with scenes depicting putti in clouds within gilt borders

item.title: krated shaped vase
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This impressive vase pays homage to the Medici family, rulers of Renaissance Florence, who highly prized vases inspired by the ancient krater form
item.content:encoded:
The Medici shaped vase on a square gilt base, the upper part curved outwards with twin gilt handles, the front painted with an outdoor scene of men hunting on their horses accompanied by their hunting dogs, additionally decorated with raised gilt detailing of wreaths of foliage and pattern-work on a green ground

The underside with blue KPM sceptre mark

item.title: japanese amari porcelain vases
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: These stunning antique Japanese vases are examples of exceptionally high quality Imari porcelain ware, which is renowned for its beauty and craftsmanship
item.content:encoded: Decorated throughout with floral patterns; the porcelain Japanese, c.1700, the ormolu French, 19th Century.

item.title: porcelain vases
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The porcelain of these fine antique vases dates to the Chinese Kangxi period, and is notable for the high quality detailing of its narrative scenes.
item.content:encoded:
The ormolu French, late 19th Century by Henri Vian (French, 1860-1905); the porcelain Chinese, early 18th Century, Kangxi period.

Each of baluster form decorated with a procession of a figure on horseback with attendants in gardens and an immortal hovering on a cloud with a baby above a bridge, the ormolu signed ‘h. Vian’.

item.title: Ormolu mounted sevres
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This exquisite Sèvres style French porcelain vase is decorated with scenes of pastoral idyll, examples of both beauty and serenity.
item.content:encoded: The dark blue ground body painted to the front with playful and amorous pastoral scenes, decorated throughout with gilt rocaille motif, mounted with twin ormolu handles shaped as winged classical female busts, surmounted by a shaped bulbous cover topped with an ormolu presentoir filled with fruit, raised on three hoof feet standing on a shaped triform base with toupie feet.

item.title: representing water
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: This exquisite Meissen porcelain ewer, representative of 'water', was created as part of a series of four ewers, each symbolising a different element.
item.content:encoded: After the model by J.J. Kaendler, with a relief naval scene, flanked by figures of Neptune, a mermaid and galloping horses, the circular flaring base with spouting dolphins among bulrushes, the underside with under glaze blue crossed swords mark above one cancellation line, incised model number 320 and impressed numerals.
